channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-16567] Upgrade to protobuf-3.1.x
item.description:
Move master branch on to protobuf3. See https://github.com/google/protobuf/releases We'd do it because pb3 saves some on byte copies can work with offheap buffers – needed for the off-heap write path project – though read-time is still a TODO (this means pb3 is not enough; we'll have to patch it – or patch pb2.5).

HBASE-15638 has us first shading protobufs before upgrading. Let us list here issues just going to pb3 without shading if only for completeness sake; i.e. do we have to shade?

  • pb3 is by default wire compatible with pb2.
  • protoc3 run against our .protos works fine except pb3 breaks our HBaseZeroCopyLiteralByteString hack so this has to be removed (possibly recast using new pb3 types)
  • Starting up a cluster that is all pb3 seems to work fine.
  • A pb2 branch-1 can read and write against the pb3 master cluster.

What will break if we just upgrade to pb3?

  • We should be able to write HDFS messages on our AsyncWAL using pb3; the pb2 HDFS should be able to read them (not tested). Or maybe not. See policy here: https://github.com/google/protobuf/issues/1852 which seems to indicate pb3s will not be able to write compatible pb2 Messages. TODO.
  • Core Coprocessor Endpoints such as AccessControl seem to just work (their protos will have been protoc3'd). I did simple test with a server from master branch up on pb3 and then going against it with a branch-1 client on pb2. I was able to add grants.
  • For non-core CPEPs where the protos are pb2 still, it might just work. To test. It would not be the end-of-the-world if they did not.

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: Attached patch is pretty much same as a patch that ramkrishna.s.vasudevan and Anoop Sam John have been slinging around for a while only in this case, ByteStringer and HBaseZeroCopyByteString are removed. Posting to see what fails in our test run.

Just a note to say that upgrading our pb to pb3 w/o running protoc3, we do pretty good but fail reading trailers on hfiles. We can't find CellComparator. TODO: check why.

One question on the pom upgrade.
When I did this some time back I found this,
Just adding the note I had stored when we did this upgrade


the actual protoc.exe version shows 3.0.0 but the protobuf-java .jars are of 3.0.0-beta2. so things does not work. 

Since when we configure 3.0.0-beta 2 in hbase pom the protoc says it needs 3.0.0. When we configure 3.0.0 in hbase pom

it says canoot find 3.0.0 protobuf jar. Hence renmaed 3.0.0-beta2 jar to 3.0.0 protobuf jar.

Also how were you able to compile the .proto files under src/test folder?
ramkrishna.s.vasudevan I don't think I had your issues because protobuf3 was released end of July: http://mvnrepository.com/artifact/com.google.protobuf/protobuf-java/3.0.0
Ya. I just saw their page after adding that comment that it got released.

-1 overall

For non-core CPEPs where the protos are pb2 still, it might just work. To test. It would not be the end-of-the-world if they did not.

Do we only accept Endpoints with pb2.5? I think it is really hard to support both pb2.5 and pb3 for Endpoint? Maybe some classloader magic?

Thanks.
HBASE-15638 is where I'm trying to find the classloader magic. tl;dr I've not found it yet. Duo Zhang

pb3.1.0 just went out. On top of the current set of unsafe additions added in pb3, they have added:

Experimental API: Added UnsafeByteOperations.unsafeWrap(byte[]) to wrap a byte array into ByteString without copy.

This latter makes it so we can purge our HBaseZeroCopyByteString class.

Patch goes in nicely over the top of HBASE-16264

Regenerate all protos in this module with protoc3.
Redo ByteStringer to use new pb3.1.0 unsafebytesutil
instead of HBaseZeroCopyByteString

-1 overall
